symjax.initializers¶

symjax.initializers.glorot(shape, gain=1, distribution=<function normal>)[source]¶

Glorot weight initialization. This is also known as Xavier initialization [1]_. :param initializer: Initializer used to sample the weights, must accept std in its

constructor to sample from a distribution with a given standard deviation.

Parameters

  • gain (float or 'relu') – Scaling factor for the weights. Set this to 1.0 for linear and sigmoid units, to ‘relu’ or sqrt(2) for rectified linear units, and to sqrt(2/(1+alpha**2)) for leaky rectified linear units with leakiness alpha. Other transfer functions may need different factors.

  • c01b (bool) – For a lasagne.layers.cuda_convnet.Conv2DCCLayer constructed with dimshuffle=False, c01b must be set to True to compute the correct fan-in and fan-out.

References

1

Xavier Glorot and Yoshua Bengio (2010): Understanding the difficulty of training deep feedforward neural networks. International conference on artificial intelligence and statistics.

Notes

For a DenseLayer, if gain='relu' and initializer=Uniform, the weights are initialized as .. math:

a &= \sqrt{\frac{12}{fan_{in}+fan_{out}}}\\
W &\sim U[-a, a]

If gain=1 and initializer=Normal, the weights are initialized as .. math:

\sigma &= \sqrt{\frac{2}{fan_{in}+fan_{out}}}\\
W &\sim N(0, \sigma)
symjax.initializers.he(shape, gain=1.4142135623730951, distribution=<function normal>)[source]¶

He weight initialization. Weights are initialized with a standard deviation of \(\sigma = gain \sqrt{\frac{1}{fan_{in}}}\) [1]_. :param initializer: Initializer used to sample the weights, must accept std in its

constructor to sample from a distribution with a given standard deviation.

Parameters

  • gain (float or 'relu') – Scaling factor for the weights. Set this to 1.0 for linear and sigmoid units, to ‘relu’ or sqrt(2) for rectified linear units, and to sqrt(2/(1+alpha**2)) for leaky rectified linear units with leakiness alpha. Other transfer functions may need different factors.

  • c01b (bool) – For a lasagne.layers.cuda_convnet.Conv2DCCLayer constructed with dimshuffle=False, c01b must be set to True to compute the correct fan-in and fan-out.

References

1

Kaiming He et al. (2015): Delving deep into rectifiers: Surpassing human-level performance on imagenet classification. arXiv preprint arXiv:1502.01852.

See also

HeNormal()

Shortcut with Gaussian initializer.

HeUniform()

Shortcut with uniform initializer.

symjax.initializers.normal(shape, mean=0.0, std=1.0)[source]¶

Sample initial weights from the Gaussian distribution. Initial weight parameters are sampled from N(mean, std). :param std: Std of initial parameters. :type std: float :param mean: Mean of initial parameters. :type mean: float

symjax.initializers.uniform(shape, range=0.01, std=None, mean=0.0)[source]¶

Sample initial weights from the uniform distribution. Parameters are sampled from U(a, b). :param range: When std is None then range determines a, b. If range is a float the

weights are sampled from U(-range, range). If range is a tuple the weights are sampled from U(range[0], range[1]).

Parameters

  • std (float or None) – If std is a float then the weights are sampled from U(mean - numpy.sqrt(3) * std, mean + numpy.sqrt(3) * std).

  • mean (float) – see std for description.
